poem:
Corrections Whisper in the Wind

The ink of truth,
thinned by errors' hand,
spills like whispers
over the restless land.

Sara's time—misplaced—
a fragile leaf adrift,
and power's shadow
shifts, elusive, swift.

Yet in these lines,
hope's quiet refrain:
through humble correction,
integrity's gain.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Corrections and clarifications • An article (Dutch centrists heading for power as far right slumps, exit poll suggests, 30 October, p2) said the VVD party improved its seat tally from the 2023 election; in fact, it lost two seats and finished with 22. Also, the GL/PvdA alliance finished fourth, not third. • Sara Sharif, 10, was killed by her father and stepmother in 2023, not last year as we said (A mother’s campaign to change rules". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
